p: These findings confirm that ‘diabetes and blood pressure’ were the most prevalently occurring diseases in the area that might be due to excessive use of fats/butter (ghee) and change of life towards sedentary and luxurious mode. The second common type of diseases were ‘rabies and other sting pains’ followed by ‘arthritis and joint disorders’ which might be due to large occurrence of wild dogs, jackals and snakes in forest or dense plants areas of mountains of Samahni, AJK. The arthritis and knee pains were also common in the area that might be due to carrying of heavy carriage or luggage by inhabitants in form of woods and grasses to cope their daily life necessities. These findings were congruent with previous works [ 122– 127]. The overall ICF values of the diseases occurring in the area were similar with studies conducted in different areas of Pakistan [ 90, 128] and Azad Kashmir [ 129, 130].
